intro: Adhatoda lithospermifolia, commonly known as the Chinese skullcap, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional Chinese medicine.
